newsitem.title: USA: INDIA AUTO MARKET GROWTH SEEN STRONG NEXT 10 YRS.
newsitem.headline: INDIA AUTO MARKET GROWTH SEEN STRONG NEXT 10 YRS.

text.p: India's automobile market should experience stronger growth than all or most other Asian auto markets over the next 10 years, according to a report by forecasting group DRI/McGraw-Hill.
Over the coming decade, economic reforms and rapidly growing demand for autos should provide long-term opportunities for the world's automakers, the report said.
It cautioned, however, that distribution problems and competition from foreign and domestic firms could impede profitability.

"India will continue to experience some of the strongest auto market growth rates in all of Asia, both in terms of aggregate growth figures and percentage growth," said Ashvin Chotai, chief Asian automotive industry analyst at DRI/McGraw-Hill.
Intense competition will prevent short- or medium-term profitability for foreign auto manufacturers in India and other Asian nations, Chotai said.
"Expansion into and throughout the Asian auto market by foreign manufacturers must be viewed as a long-term investment with vast potential," he said.
